channel.title: Court Wizard Useful?
channel.description:
Passive
None
Day Ability (usually court wizards are ALWAYS suspicious and tends to always get exe votes)
Magical Influence(1 use): You can force pardon yourself for the first 5 days. (Sage - Dark Manipulation: Same effect) (Sometimes it's best to get exe to draw attention away from MM and/or Assassin)
Night Ability
life Extent: If your target is attacked (not poisoned or bleed), they will live for 1 more day unless healed. If you use Life Extend on the same target, they will live for another day.
Wizards' Intimidation(2 uses): Causes your attacker to attack another target that's not DB.

item.title: Court Wizard Useful?
item.dc:creator: Vandalay
item.description:
I’m missing what you mean by “somewhat claimable”, if they make him testable (IE ability that others know if it is or isn’t’ used). Right now I have more of a problem with the game as a whole being too solvable, and the only balancing factor for this problem currently is bad players. I could care less if one or 2 classes aren’t the most fun thing on earth to play, if their existance makes all other classes have a game.

Here’s the further point… we take more classes out of fakable claims… the pressure on the ones in it go up 5x… if CW is moved into very testable, compared to the “almost untestable” category he is in… you bet your butt the “lul” knight, phys, sheriff/pali" factors will go up tenfold. massively raising the complaints of both being evil, and being one of those classes. Because the smaller that pool is, the more strategically advantageous it is to execute first ask questions later, with them.
